A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It is evident that the \"new\" Star Wars franchise is trying to separate itself from past movies/storylines. This is not to say that The Last Jedi is a bad movie\, just that the direction of the franchise has changed. This \"change\" appears to be an attempt to captivate a new audience and generation. Diehard Star Wars fans may disapprove of the new direction of The Last Jedi\, because of increased humor\, new terms\, conflicting character development\, and unanswered questions that The Last Jedi failed to answer. However\, the bottom line is that the Last Jedi is a solid stand alone movie\, but also appears to be an attempt to engage a younger generation and represents a shift from the past franchise.
